solution.text:
\((x – \frac1x) (x + 1\frac1x) (x^2 + \frac{1}{x^2}) (x^4 + \frac{1}{x^4})\)
Using identity \((a-b)(a+b) = a^2 – b^2\)
Where \(a = x\) and \(b = \frac 1{x}\)
\(= (x^2 – \frac 1{x^2}) (x^2 + \frac 1{x^2}) (x^4 + \frac 1{x^4})\)
Once again, using identity \((a-b)(a+b) = a^2 – b^2\)
Where \(a = x^2\) and \(b = \frac 1{x^2}\)
\(= (x^4 – \frac 1{x^4}) (x^4 + \frac 1{x^4})\)
Once again, using identity \((a-b)(a+b) = a^2 – b^2\)
Where \(a = x^4\) and \(b = \frac 1{x^4}\)
\(= (x^8 – \frac 1{x^8})\)
